intro: Lewisia brachycalyx, commonly known as the broadleaf lewisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming growth habit and striking, showy flowers. The plant produces vibrant pink to red blossoms that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements make it well-suited for arid and semi-arid climates.
